column4: so i just have to use partition commander to resize my windows partition to make space for xubuntu and then when i install linux it will make set xubuntu in the unused space right?
as long as i don't tell it to use the whole hard drive
i rather not use linux to mess with ntfs paritions
i prefer to use partition commander
then just run the xubuntu install and tell it to used the unused space and make whaterver paritions it wants for linux
has anyone ever use system commander before?
i'm wondering if its any good
if you're using an older machine, it's great. It is slightly harder in some cases to find appropriate software, however.
